qas.question: What was Sweden's motivation to join the war?

answers.text: Sweden, fearing Prussia's expansionist tendencies, went to war in 1757 to protect its Baltic dominions,
Spain, bound by the Pacte de Famille, intervened on behalf of France and together they launched a disastrous invasion of Portugal
Spain, bound by the Pacte de Famille, intervened on behalf of France and together they launched a disastrous invasion of Portugal in 1762

qas.question: What was the result of the invasion by Spain?

qas.question: What region did Austria hope to recapture?

answers.text: Austria formed an alliance with France, seeing an opportunity to recapture Silesia, which had been lost in a previous war

context: Realizing that war was imminent, Prussia preemptively struck Saxony and quickly overran it. The result caused uproar across Europe. Because of Prussia's alliance with Britain, <a4_0>Austria formed an alliance with France, seeing an opportunity to recapture Silesia, which had been lost in a previous war<a4_0/>. Reluctantly, by following the imperial diet, most of the states of the empire joined Austria's cause. The Anglo-Prussian alliance was joined by smaller German states (especially Hanover). <a0_0>Sweden, fearing Prussia's expansionist tendencies, went to war in 1757 to protect its Baltic dominions,<a0_0/> seeing its chance when virtually all of Europe opposed Prussia. <a1_0><a2_0><a3_0>Spain, bound by the Pacte de Famille, intervened on behalf of France and together they launched a disastrous invasion<a3_0/> of Portugal<a1_0/> in 1762<a2_0/>. The Russian Empire was originally aligned with Austria, fearing Prussia's ambition on the Polish-Lithuanian Commonwealth, but switched sides upon the succession of Tsar Peter III in 1762.
